title: NO POTTING UP METHOD FOR TOMATO SEEDLINGS  - One Cup Method for Huge Tomatoes

tasks.task: Starting tomatoes from seed indoors using the solo cup method.
subtasks: Drill holes in the bottom of solo cups for drainage.
Gather materials including solo cups, seed starting mix, and a tray with a rim.
Moisten seed starting mix before filling solo cups.
Fill solo cups halfway with moistened seed starting mix.
Press the soil down to remove air pockets.
Plant 2-3 tomato seeds on the surface.
Cover seeds with a quarter-inch of soil and vermiculite.
Water the cups by filling the tray with 2-3 inches of water and allowing it to soak up.
Use a grow light for the initial growth period.
When seedlings reach above the cups, trim leaves below the rim.
Pot up by filling cups to the top with potting soil.
Continue growing under lights or in a sunny location.
Harden off plants before transplanting outside.
